thread.title: Kim Kardashian Says 'KUWTK' Paris Robbery Episode Will Be 'Very Tough' to Watch
thread.title_full: Kim Kardashian Says 'KUWTK' Paris Robbery Episode Will Be 'Very Tough' to Watch

title: Kim Kardashian Says 'KUWTK' Paris Robbery Episode Will Be 'Very Tough' to Watch
text:
See How Much Kim, Khloe and Kourtney Kash in for Instagram Ads "I would never wish this experience upon anyone, but have learned some valuable lessons & feel so blessed to be safe home with my babies & husband," Kardashian continued, referencing her 3-year-old daughter North, 15-month-old son Saint and husband Kanye West . "To my friends, family, and loved ones I can't thank you enough for being there when I needed you the most. To the French police, thank you for your incredible hard work." Kim Kardashian’s Most Shocking Sheer Outfits 
The Selfish author accompanied her Instagram note with a photo of herself, mom Kris Jenner and sisters Kourtney Kardashian and Kendall Jenner having dinner before the harrowing October 2016 incident. "This was our last family photo taken in Paris," she captioned the picture. A post shared by Kim Kardashian West (@kimkardashian) on Mar 19, 2017 at 11:44am PDT 
The KUWTK episode will mark the first time Kim has extensively spoken out about the night she was tied up and robbed at gunpoint of more than $10 million in jewelry while inside her private residence at Hôtel de Pourtalès in Paris. In previews released ahead of the episode, Kim breaks down in tears as she tells Kourtney, 37, and Khloé Kardashian that she was afraid the burglars were going to shoot her in the back. 
Several suspects were arrested in January, with 10 people charged in connection with the crime. 14 Times Kim Kardashian Was Actually Funny 
Keeping Up With the Kardashians airs on E! Sundays at 9 p.m. ET.
